meanings.sent1: The little lamb outbleats its siblings during feeding time.
meanings.sent2: The sheep outbleats the goats in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The lamb outbleats the rooster, trying to wake everyone up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outbleats the sound of the wind in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The loudspeaker outbleats the noise of the bustling city.

meanings.sent1: The baby outbleats all the other children in the nursery.
meanings.sent2: The cat outbleats the dog when it wants attention.
meanings.sent3: The toddler outbleats the sirens passing by, demanding a cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her voice outbleats the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent5: The singer outbleats the crowd with her powerful vocals.

meanings.sent1: The goat outbleats the sheep in the competition for attention.
meanings.sent2: The donkey outbleats the horse in the barnyard.
meanings.sent3: The piglet outbleats the pig, trying to sound more mature.
